etymologies: mid 17th century. Short for post-classical Latin de novo damus ‘we grant anew’ (from de novo anew + damus, 3rd person plural indicative of dare to give), a phrase which appears in the charters

definitions: (A charter containing) a clause by which a feudal superior renews a former grant (now specifically with an alteration or correction). Also as "charter (clause,etc.) of novodamus".
